requirements.summary: Make the Resize Options mode selector (By Pixels / By Percentage / Target Size) responsive and prevent mobile overflow while keeping active/inactive styling consistent.
acceptanceCriteria: On narrow/mobile viewports, the mode selector (By Pixels / By Percentage / Target Size) does not cause horizontal page overflow.
All three mode buttons remain visible and tappable on mobile (no clipping, overlap, or off-screen rendering).
The mode selector layout adapts responsively (e.g., wraps to multiple lines or allows safe horizontal scrolling) without breaking desktop layout.
Active/inactive tab background and text colors are visually correct and consistent with the app theme (no unreadable text or missing background).

file_operations.description: Adjust the TabsList/TabsTrigger class usage to prevent overflow on mobile (e.g., replace rigid grid layout with a wrapping flex layout or safe horizontal scrolling) and explicitly set responsive padding/typography plus theme-consistent active/inactive colors via utility classes. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update Resize Options form layouts across modes to avoid input/control overflow on mobile, including the Target Size input + unit selector row.
acceptanceCriteria: In 'Target Size' mode on mobile, the numeric input and unit dropdown do not overflow their container and remain fully visible.
In 'By Pixels' mode on mobile, width/height inputs are readable and do not overflow; the layout stacks or compresses appropriately.
No horizontal scrolling is introduced by any controls within the Image Resize options card at common mobile widths (e.g., ~320px).

file_operations.description: Refine responsive layout classes for each mode's controls: ensure pixel inputs use mobile-safe widths (e.g., min-w-0) and stacking behavior, and change the Target Size input + unit selector container to stack on small screens (e.g., flex-col on mobile, flex-row on larger) with width-safe SelectTrigger sizing. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Polish responsive spacing and typography in the Resize Options section across devices without changing resize behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The Resize Image page options area has comfortable padding and spacing on mobile and does not look cramped or oversized compared to tablet/desktop.
No functional changes to the resize logic occur; only presentation/layout/styling is adjusted.
All user-facing labels remain in English and unchanged in meaning.

file_operations.description: Tune responsive spacing/typography for the options card and header row: apply mobile-first padding (e.g., smaller base padding with sm+ increase), ensure the header/quality selector wraps cleanly on narrow screens, and standardize spacing between sections while keeping all existing labels/text unchanged. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
